verses.text: 神規劃萬事叫人敬畏他萬事都有定期，天下萬務都有定時：

words.note: Refers to the singular, true God.
A deep respect combined with fear of authority.
Refers to a set or predetermined period.
Literally 'under heaven', a classical term for the world.
A more formal or literary equivalent of '萬事'.
Similar to '定期', emphasizing a precise moment or period.

verses.text: 生有時，死有時；栽種有時，拔出所種的也有時；

words.note: Functions as a verbal phrase indicating an appropriate time for something.
Indicates the object of a verb or a passive construction.
Here, functions to nominalize '所種', meaning 'that which has been planted'.

verses.text: 殺戮有時，醫治有時；拆毀有時，建造有時；

words.note: A more formal or literary term for killing, often on a large scale.

verses.text: 哭有時，笑有時；哀慟有時，踴躍有時；

words.note: Refers to deep sorrow or lamentation, often in a ritualistic context.
To leap for joy; a more expressive form of rejoicing.

verses.text: 拋擲石頭有時，堆聚石頭有時；擁抱有時，避免擁抱有時；

words.note: A formal or literary term for throwing, suggesting deliberate action.
To accumulate or gather things together, often in a heap.
A verb-object compound functioning as a single action unit.

verses.text: 尋找有時，捨棄有時；保存有時，拋棄有時；

words.definition: sometimes, there is a time for
sometimes, there is a time for
sometimes, there is a time for
sometimes, there is a time for

verses.text: 撕裂有時，縫補有時；靜默有時，講話有時；

words.definition: sometimes, there is a time for
sometimes, there is a time for

words.note: Often found in religious or formal contexts.

words.definition: sometimes, there is a time for
sometimes, there is a time for

verses.text: 愛有時，恨有時；戰爭有時，和平有時。

words.definition: sometimes, there is a time for
sometimes, there is a time for
sometimes, there is a time for
sometimes, there is a time for

verses.text: 作工的人在自己的勞碌上得到甚麼益處呢？

words.note: Refers to strenuous work or effort.
Used with 在...上 to indicate 'in the aspect of' or 'regarding'.

verses.text: 我看 神給予世人的擔子，是要他們為此煩惱。

words.note: The elevated space indicates reverence for 'God' in older Chinese texts.
More formal than just '給'.
Refers to all people, often with a theological or philosophical nuance.

words.definition: to intend, to cause, to want
words.note: Here, it means to cause or make them do something.

words.definition: for this reason, because of this
words.note: A formal way to say 'because of this'.

verses.text: 他使萬事各按其時，成為美好；他又把永恆的意識放在人的心裡；雖然這樣，人還是不能察覺 神自始至終的作為。

words.note: A somewhat literary term for 'its appropriate time'.
Often used in philosophical or religious contexts.

verses.text: 我曉得人生最好是尋樂享福，
人人有吃有喝，在自己的一切勞碌中自得其樂；這就是 神的恩賜。

words.note: More formal/literary than simply 'work' or 'labor'.
An idiom meaning to be content with one's own lot.
Refers to a divine or special gift, a spiritual blessing.

verses.text: 我知道 神所作的一切，都必永存，無可增添，無可減少； 神這樣作，為要使人在他面前存敬畏的心。

words.note: Forms a nominalized phrase (e.g., 所作 means 'what is done').
More formal/literary, often in religious contexts.

words.definition: cannot be, there's no way to
words.note: Formal, used with verbs to express impossibility.

words.definition: cannot be, there's no way to
in order to, so as to
words.note: Formal or literary way to express purpose.
Often refers to reverential fear of God.

verses.text: 現在有的，先前就有；將來有的，早已有了；因為 神使已過的事重新出現（「使已過的事重新出現」直譯是「尋找被追趕的」）。

words.note: More formal or literary for 'past' or 'that which has passed'.

verses.text: 神的審判都有定時我在日光之下又看見：審判的地方有奸惡，維護公義的地方也有奸惡。
我自己心裡說：「 神必審判義人和惡人，因為各樣事務、各樣工作都有定時。」

words.definition: all kinds of, every kind of
all kinds of, every kind of

verses.text: 我自己心裡說：「至於世人， 神要試驗他們，使他們看見自己與牲畜無異。

words.note: Lit. 'world people'

verses.text: 因為世人所遭遇的與牲畜所遭遇的，都是一樣：這個怎樣死，那個也怎樣死，兩者的氣息都是一樣，所以人並不勝於牲畜。一切都是虛空。

words.note: Lit. 'world people'
A key theme in Ecclesiastes.

verses.text: 大家都到一個地方去，都出於塵土，也都歸回塵土。

words.note: Refers to the dust from which humans were formed (Genesis 2:7).
Refers to the dust from which humans were formed (Genesis 2:7).

verses.text: 有誰知道人的靈是往上升，牲畜的魂（「魂」的原文與「靈」〔3:21〕和「氣息」〔3:19〕相同）是下降而入地呢？」

words.note: Often refers to the immaterial part of humans.
Refers to non-human animals.
The parenthetical note clarifies it's the same original word as 靈.
Refers to the breath of life.

verses.text: 因此我看人最好是在自己所作的事上自得其樂，因為這也是他的分；誰能使他看見他自己死後的事呢？

words.note: Nominalizes the following verb.
Combines with 所 to form a noun phrase.
Indicates scope or aspect.

words.definition: to find joy in one's work
words.note: An idiom meaning to be content with one's lot.
Refers to one's allotted share in life.
